title: Congress releases 2nd list of 26 candidates for Delhi assembly polls - The Times of India
summary:
Congress releases 2nd list of 26 candidates for Delhi assembly polls

Publication Date: October 16, 2023  |  Source: Times of India

The Congress party has released its second list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, consisting of 26 names. This announcement comes as the party strategizes to strengthen its position in the capital.

  • The list includes several former MLAs aiming to reclaim their seats.
  • There are new faces added to the list, indicating a mix of experience and fresh perspectives.
  • The decision reflects Congress's efforts to revitalize its campaign ahead of the polls.
“We are committed to bringing back the Congress government in Delhi,” stated a senior party leader.

The announcement of the candidates is a strategic move by the Congress party as it seeks to regain influence in Delhi's political landscape. The upcoming elections present a crucial opportunity for the party to re-establish its presence amid stiff competition.
newTitle: Congress Unveils Second List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

title: NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners - Mint
summary:
NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners

Publication Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Mint

The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has imposed penalties and debarments on Deloitte and two of its partners for professional misconduct during their audits of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) for two financial years.

This ruling involves severe penalties totaling ₹2.15 crore against Deloitte and accusations of missing significant irregularities, including the mishandling of a ₹200-crore fixed deposit by ZEEL.

  • NFRA imposed a ₹2 crore penalty on Deloitte and debarred one partner for five years with a ₹10 lakh fine.
  • The second partner has been debarred for three years with a ₹5 lakh penalty.
  • The actions stem from Deloitte's failure to report irregularities regarding ZEEL’s fixed deposit held with Yes Bank.
  • The ordinance highlights a lack of professional skepticism from the auditors.
“Auditors did not exercise professional skepticism and were grossly negligent in the audit of the matter related to FD closure,” - NFRA

The NFRA's actions reflect the importance of rigorous auditing standards and accountability in financial reporting.
newTitle: NFRA Penalizes Deloitte for Audit Misconduct in ZEEL Case

title: Allu Arjun Quizzed, His Bouncer Arrested; Actor Likely To Be Taken To Pushpa 2 Stampede Spot Soon - News18
summary:
Allu Arjun Quizzed After Pushpa 2 Screening Stampede

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: News18

Top Telugu actor Allu Arjun was questioned by the Chikkadpally police in connection with a woman's death during a stampede at a movie screening in Hyderabad. He was arrested earlier but granted bail.

  • Allu Arjun was grilled for four hours regarding the December 4 stampede incident during the screening of ‘Pushpa-2’.
  • His bouncer, identified as the organizer at the Sandhya Theatre, was also arrested.
  • Police are set to recreate the scene at the theater with Allu Arjun and his bouncer.
  • The investigation follows claims made by Allu Arjun in a press conference where he defended his actions during the screening.
  • A total of eleven accused have been named in the case, and social media videos of the incident have surfaced.
“There is a lot of misinformation that I behaved in a particular way (irresponsibly). These allegations are wrong. It’s humiliating and a character assassination.” - Allu Arjun

This incident has sparked public outcry and political reactions, with calls for accountability surrounding crowd control measures during events.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Quizzed After Pushpa 2 Screening Stampede

title: 5 soldiers killed as Army vehicle falls into 300-feet gorge in J&K's Poonch - The Times of India
summary:
5 Soldiers Killed as Army Vehicle Falls into 300-Feet Gorge in J&K's Poonch

Publication Date: October 2, 2023

Source: Times of India

A tragic accident occurred in the Poonch region of Jammu and Kashmir, where an army vehicle plunged into a 300-feet gorge, resulting in the deaths of five soldiers.

  • The incident happened during a routine movement in the area.
  • Rescue operations were launched promptly, but the soldiers' injuries were severe.
  • The army has expressed deep condolences to the families of the deceased.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the accident.
“The army is conducting an inquiry to ascertain the cause of the accident,” an official stated.

This unfortunate event highlights the risks faced by military personnel during their operations and the importance of ensuring their safety while on duty.
newTitle: 5 Soldiers Killed in Tragic Vehicle Accident in J&K's Poonch

title: Ajay Kumar Bhalla, ex-Union home secretary, appointed new Manipur governor - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Union home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur, replacing Laxman Prasad Acharya, according to an official order from Rashtrapati Bhavan.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla, a 1984 batch IAS officer, served as the Union home secretary until August 2024.
  • He had the longest tenure in the pivotal role of Union home secretary, starting in August 2019.
  • The recent reshuffle also includes the appointment of new governors for other states, including Arif Mohammed Khan as Bihar governor.
“Bhalla has had the longest tenure in the crucial post considered next to the country's top bureaucrat.”

This appointment comes amidst a series of gubernatorial changes in various states, aiming at better governance and administration.
newTitle: Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur

title: Congress cries foul over NHRC appointments: Read who are Justices Rohinton, Joseph, Muralidhar and Qureshi, whose names were recommended by Rahul and Kharge - OpIndia
summary:
Congress Criticizes NHRC Appointments Amid Controversy

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Various

On December 23, 2024, President Droupadi Murmu appointed retired Justice V Ramasubramanian as the Chairperson of the NHRC, along with two members. The Congress party has raised concerns over the selection process, calling it predetermined.

Key Points:

  • Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairperson with Priyank Kanoongo and Bidyut Ranjan Sarangi as members.
  • Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the selection process as flawed.
  • The dissent letter cites a lack of consultation and claims the process ignored diversity concerns.
  • Gandhi and Kharge recommended Justices Rohinton Nariman and K M Joseph, citing their qualifications and representation of marginalized communities.
  • They argue that the NHRC's credibility relies on representing India's diversity.
“The selection process was fundamentally flawed. This departure undermines the principles of fairness and impartiality.” - excerpt from dissent letter by Gandhi and Kharge

Conclusion

The Congress's proposal of controversial figures brings into question their commitment to judicial impartiality and the strengthening of institutions.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes NHRC Appointments Amid Controversy

title: Local staff working at inoperative Indian consulate in Afghanistan injured - The Times of India
summary:
Local staff injured at inactive Indian consulate in Afghanistan

Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Recent reports indicate that local staff working at the Indian consulate in Afghanistan have sustained injuries amidst ongoing tensions in the region.

  • The consulate has been inactive for some time due to security concerns.
  • Local personnel were present at the site when the incident occurred.
  • This incident underscores the precarious situation facing foreign diplomatic missions in Afghanistan.
"The security of our staff remains a top priority, and we are assessing the situation closely." - Indian Foreign Ministry

In conclusion, as the situation evolves, the safety of local staff remains critical while reflecting on the broader implications for diplomatic missions in unstable regions.
newTitle: Local staff injured at inactive Indian consulate in Afghanistan

title: Tungsten block: Centre tells Tamil Nadu to keep Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc on hold - The Hindu
summary:
Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

Published: December 24, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Union Ministry of Mines has requested a re-examination of the Nayakkarpatti tungsten block in Madurai, due to concerns over its biodiversity heritage site status, temporarily halting the issuance of the Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc Limited.

  • The Nayakkarpatti tungsten block includes six villages, notably Arittapatti, recognized for its archaeological significance.
  • The Geological Survey of India has been asked to reconsider the boundaries of the block to protect the biodiversity site.
  • The Tamil Nadu government initially notified the existence of the biodiversity site but did not oppose the auction process.
  • Concerns raised from local representations prompted the Ministry to take action.
  • Since being given the power to auction, Tamil Nadu has not auctioned any major mineral blocks in the past nine years.
“When the block was initially put up for auction in February 2024, till the auction result was declared on November 7, 2024, there was no communication from the State government regarding any opposition or concerns about the auction.”

The decision to hold off the auction highlights growing concerns over environmental protection in mining activities in Tamil Nadu.
newTitle: Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

title: Ex Bureaucrat Ajay Bhalla New Manipur Governor, Mizoram Gets Ex Army Chief VK Singh - NDTV
summary:
Ajay Bhalla Appointed as New Manipur Governor, VK Singh Takes Charge in Mizoram

Publication Date: Tuesday evening

Source: National News

Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur amidst ongoing tensions between the Meitei community and Kuki tribes. VK Singh, a retired army chief, will now govern Mizoram. Additionally, there have been changes in governance for the states of Kerala and Bihar.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla replaces Anusuiya Uikey in Manipur.
  • VK Singh has been appointed as the Governor of Mizoram.
  • Arif Mohammed Khan and Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar exchanged governorships between Kerala and Bihar.
  • Raghubar Das resigned as the Governor of Odisha, succeeded by Dr Hari Babu Kambhampati.
“A governor is the constitutional head of a state and has similar powers and functions at the state level as those of the President of India at the central level.”

The recent appointments may influence ongoing tensions in Manipur and establish a new governance dynamic in Mizoram.
newTitle: Ajay Bhalla Appointed as New Manipur Governor, VK Singh Takes Charge in Mizoram

title: Five soldiers die in accident in J&K’s Poonch: Army - The Hindu
summary:
Five Soldiers Die in Vehicle Accident in Poonch, J&K

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Five soldiers were killed on December 24, 2024, in a vehicle accident while on operational duty in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir.

  • The accident occurred in the Pir Panjal valley.
  • Preliminary reports indicate that at least seven soldiers were onboard.
  • The vehicle was traveling from Nilam headquarters to a post at Balnoi Ghora.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, and injured personnel are receiving medical care.
“Five brave soldiers lost their lives in a vehicle accident during operational duty in the Poonch sector.” - Army Spokesman

This tragic incident highlights the dangers faced by military personnel during operational duties.
newTitle: Five Soldiers Die in Vehicle Accident in Poonch, J&K

title: Spiritual content creator Abhinav Arora opens up on trolling, his chicken video: ‘I can’t go to school…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Spiritual Content Creator Abhinav Arora Talks About Trolling and School Challenges

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

10-year-old Abhinav Arora, known as 'Bal Sant', speaks out on the challenges he faces due to online trolling, affecting his ability to attend school.

  • Abhinav is facing trolling and cyberbullying, preventing him from attending school regularly.
  • He currently visits school only for exams but desires both school and spiritual education.
  • His father highlighted Abhinav's aspirations to attend 'Gurukul' for spiritual studies.
  • Abhinav clarified his 'chicken video' controversy, asserting he is pure vegetarian.
  • His title 'Bal Sant' was given by followers out of love, not as a self-identification.
“I go to school... currently, I am not going to school due to trolling.” - Abhinav Arora

In conclusion, Abhinav Arora's experiences with trolling underscore the challenges faced by young content creators in today's digital landscape.
newTitle: Spiritual Content Creator Abhinav Arora Talks About Trolling and School Challenges

title: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviews implementation of three criminal laws - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah Reviews Implementation of New Criminal Laws in Uttarakhand

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah held a meeting to assess the implementation of three new criminal laws in Uttarakhand, stressing the importance of technology and timely investigations.

  • Shah reviewed the implementation status with the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB).
  • He emphasized generating alerts for criminal cases to expedite investigations.
  • Shah demanded full implementation of the laws as soon as possible.
  • He advocated for the use of more forensic vans in every district.
  • Regular monitoring of Zero FIRs and transfer of cases has been stressed.
“There should be regular and continuous monitoring of how many of the total Zero FIRs registered have been brought to justice.”

In conclusion, the implementation of these laws is critical for justice enhancement in Uttarakhand, and the Home Minister is pushing for swift action and technological upgrades.
newTitle: Amit Shah Reviews Implementation of New Criminal Laws in Uttarakhand

title: PM Modi stresses fundamental change in the mindset for Viksit Bharat - Business Standard
summary:
PM Modi stresses fundamental change in the mindset for Viksit Bharat

Date: Not specifiedSource: Not specified

Ahead of the presentation of the Budget for FY26, Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with economists focusing on maintaining India's growth amidst global uncertainties. He emphasized that achieving Viksit Bharat requires a fundamental change in mindset aimed at making India developed by 2047.

  • Meeting included discussions on global economic challenges and strategies for enhancing employment, especially for youth.
  • Participants highlighted the importance of aligning education with job market demands.
  • There were discussions on improving agricultural productivity, rural employment, and attracting private investment.
  • Conversations also revolved around skilling, vocational education, and integrating into global markets.
  • Prominent economists attended, sharing insights for actionable policies to sustain growth in an uncertain environment.
“Our mandate was to discuss actionable policies to help sustain India’s growth momentum in an increasingly uncertain geopolitical and economic environment.” - Pritam Banerjee

This meeting aimed to develop strategies that align India's growth with evolving economic challenges, ensuring the country's economic stability and growth potential for the future.
newTitle: PM Modi emphasizes a change in mindset for Viksit Bharat by 2047

title: Bhopal Violent Clash: Groups Attack Each Other With Sticks, Wield Swords; 6 Injured | Video - News18
Central panel withdraws GRAP IV restrictions in Delhi-NCR after dip in air pollution levels - The Times of India
summary:
Central panel withdraws GRAP IV restrictions in Delhi-NCR after dip in air pollution levels

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Not specified

The central panel has lifted the GRAP IV restrictions imposed in the Delhi-NCR region after observing a significant dip in air pollution levels. This decision comes as a relief to many residents impacted by the restrictions.

  • The GRAP IV restrictions were initially put in place due to alarming levels of air pollution.
  • Recent data shows a marked improvement in air quality, leading to this reversal.
  • This change is expected to positively impact daily life and economic activities in the area.
“The air quality has shown favorable trends, making it possible to withdraw the restrictions,” said an official.

This decision highlights the importance of monitoring air quality and adjusting regulations accordingly to balance public health and daily activities.
newTitle: GRAP IV Restrictions Lifted in Delhi-NCR Following Air Quality Improvement

Several Soldiers Feared Injured As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In J&K - NDTV
summary:
Several Soldiers Feared Injured As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In J&K

Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: NDTV Newsdesk

Several soldiers are feared injured as an Army truck plunged into a 300-foot gorge in the sensitive border district of Poonch in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday. Rescue operations are underway.

  • Incident occurred in Poonch district, Jammu and Kashmir.
  • Army vehicle fell into a 300-foot gorge.
  • Rescue operations have started to locate the injured.
"Rescue operations are underway."

The situation is still developing as more details are awaited regarding the incident and the extent of injuries.

title: Arbitration Act: Important Judgments By Supreme Court In 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Key Supreme Court Rulings on Arbitration Act in 2024

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

As 2024 concludes, LiveLaw presents a summary of significant Supreme Court judgments pertaining to the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.

  • Arbitral Awards and Modification: The Supreme Court ruled that arbitral awards cannot be modified under Sections 34 and 37 of the Arbitration Act, emphasizing adherence to the intended limitations of the Act.
  • Referral to Larger Bench: A case was referred to a larger bench to determine if courts have the authority to modify awards under the mentioned sections.
  • Amendment Suggestion: The Court suggested Parliament consider amending the Act to establish a limitation period for filing Section 11 applications.
  • Specificity Required for Arbitration Clause: The Court maintained that arbitration clauses must have specific references to be enforceable across contracts.
  • Enforcement of Foreign Awards: Enforcement of foreign awards should only be denied in rare instances, following international standards of bias determination.
  • Limitation and Time Extensions: The Court clarified the extension of time limits for the passing of awards and emphasized limitation periods for appeals based on the Limitation Act.
“Interference with an arbitral award under Section 34 must be confined to permissible grounds under the statute,” affirmed the Supreme Court.

The series of rulings reflect the Court's ongoing efforts to clarify procedural aspects of arbitration and address legislative gaps, contributing to a more defined legal framework within which arbitrations will proceed.
newTitle: Key Supreme Court Rulings on Arbitration Act in 2024

title: UP: Bareilly court summons Asaduddin Owaisi over ‘Jai Palestine’ slogan during Parliament oath - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bareilly Court Summons Asaduddin Owaisi Over 'Jai Palestine' Slogan During Parliament Oath

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

A local court in Bareilly has summoned AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his support for Palestine during his oath-taking in Parliament.

  • The court has scheduled a hearing for January 7, 2025.
  • The summons stemmed from a petition filed by lawyer Virendra Gupta, claiming Owaisi's slogan violated constitutional principles.
  • The original petition was rejected, but a revision was approved by the district judge.
  • Owaisi defended his slogan, stating it was not against the Constitution and supported the cause of people in Palestine.
  • He recently won his fifth consecutive election from Hyderabad.
“His slogan was against the Constitution.” - Virendra Gupta

This incident has sparked debate about the appropriateness of political statements made during official ceremonies.
newTitle: Bareilly Court Summons Asaduddin Owaisi Over 'Jai Palestine' Slogan During Parliament Oath

title: Posing As RAW Agent, Agra Gym Trainer Rapes Canadian Woman He Met On Tinder | Shocking Details - News18
‘Constitutional posts not to settle scores’: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar reacts to Opposition’s no-trust motion against him - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Constitutional posts not to settle scores’: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar reacts to Opposition’s no-trust motion against him

Publication Date: December 19, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In response to the Opposition's notice for his removal, Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar emphasized that individuals in constitutional roles should not engage in settling scores and expressed concerns about actions that threaten national interests.

  • Dhankhar accused the Rajya Sabha Chairman of being “explicitly partisan” and criticized the opposition's motion as flawed.
  • He quoted Chandra Shekhar, stating the notice against him was inadequate and hastily prepared.
  • The Vice President highlighted the importance of expression and dialogue in a democracy.
  • Dhankhar cautioned against orchestrated efforts that may harm national interests.
  • The motion is viewed as a significant yet largely symbolic exercise by the opposition.
“If expression is qualified, compromised, or made subject to coercion, democratic values are flawed.” - Jagdeep Dhankhar

This situation marks the first instance in India's parliamentary history where a no-confidence motion has been filed against a sitting Vice President, symbolizing ongoing tensions in political discourse.
newTitle: Vice President Dhankhar Responds to Opposition's No-Trust Motion

title: Attack On Locals Linked To Defunct Indian Mission In Afghanistan's Jalalabad - News18
Anti-Pollution Measures (GRAP-4) Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves - NDTV
summary:
Anti-Pollution Measures (GRAP-4) Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves

Publication Date: Recent Source: Local News

The stringent anti-pollution measure GRAP-4 has been revoked in Delhi as the air quality continues to improve. The air quality index (AQI) has seen a significant dip, prompting the sub-committee to lift the restrictions.

  • The AQI was recorded at 364, which is categorized as 'very poor' but is 36 points below the thresholds for Stage-4 measures.
  • Stage-4 measures were reimposed on December 16 due to rising pollution levels.
  • The AQI is expected to remain in the 'very poor' category in the coming days, influenced by favorable weather conditions.
  • Measures previously included a ban on construction activities and restrictions on non-essential trucks and school classes.
"The AQI is likely to remain in ‘very poor’ category in the coming days due to favourable meteorological conditions."

In conclusion, the lifting of GRAP-4 measures reflects improvements in Delhi's air quality, though caution remains as conditions could shift.
newTitle: Anti-Pollution Measures (GRAP-4) Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves

title: 'Impressed by Ram Mandir': Mauritius foreign minister on Ayodhya temple visit - Hindustan Times
Ladki Bahin Yojana: Transfer of ₹1,500 resumes for eligible women in Maharashtra | Mint - Mint
summary:
Ladki Bahin Yojana: Transfer of ₹1,500 Resumes for Eligible Women in Maharashtra

Publication Date: Recent

Source: PTI

The monthly disbursements under the Ladki Bahin scheme in Maharashtra have resumed after a pause due to the model code of conduct during the assembly elections.

  • The instalments will be disbursed in phases to nearly 12.87 lakh beneficiaries.
  • The scheme provides ₹1,500 per month to eligible women.
  • Aditi Tatkare stated that they expect the number of beneficiaries to grow as registration continues.
  • The previous Chief Minister had promised to increase the assistance from ₹1,500 to ₹2,100 in the next budget.
“Taking another important step towards women empowerment... the Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana is running successfully.” — Aditi Tatkare

This initiative aims to support women financially, thereby enhancing their capabilities and contributions to society.
newTitle: Ladki Bahin Yojana: Transfer of ₹1,500 Resumes for Eligible Women in Maharashtra

summary:
'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case: What Cops Asked Actor Allu Arjun in 4 Hours of Questioning

Publication Date: October 2023   |   Source: Times of India

Actor Allu Arjun was questioned for four hours regarding the recent stampede incident related to his film 'Pushpa 2'. The police sought details about the event’s organization and safety measures.

  • Allu Arjun was questioned to understand the events leading up to the stampede.
  • The police were particularly interested in safety protocols followed during the event.
  • The actor expressed his concerns over fan safety during promotions.
“The well-being of my fans is my priority,” said Allu Arjun during the questioning.

This incident raises significant questions about event management and public safety, especially concerning large gatherings related to popular films.

title: British soldier who 'ran module behind Punjab grenade attack' was in Indian Army. Brother still serving - ThePrint
summary:
British Soldier Linked to Punjab Grenade Attack Identified

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ThePrint

A UK-based suspected Khalistan Zindabad Force (KZF) operative, linked to the December grenade attack in Punjab, was previously part of the Indian Army. Jagjeet Singh, 37, known for his connections to KZF, is said to be currently serving in the British Army.

  • Jagjeet Singh hails from Tarn Taran’s Miyapur village.
  • He served in the Indian Army's Sikh regiment alongside his elder brother, who remains in service.
  • Jagjeet is linked to operations behind a grenade attack on a police outpost in Gurdaspur.
  • The investigation is expanding to identify connections with other KZF operatives.
  • Audio released by KZF chief Ranjeet Singh Nita alleges police conspiracy regarding the encounter of their operatives.
“This is nothing but a conspiracy by both Punjab and UP Police.” – Ranjeet Singh Nita

The investigation is ongoing, with police looking into broader connections to foreign funding aiding local KZF operations.
newTitle: British Soldier Linked to Punjab Grenade Attack Identified

title: Congress moves Supreme Court against amendment to Conduct of Election Rules - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Congress Challenges Supreme Court Over Changes to Election Rules

Published on: 24 Dec 2024, 12:13 pm

The Congress party has petitioned the Supreme Court of India against recent amendments to the Conduct of Election Rules, which they argue restrict citizens' access to election-related records.

  • Amendments to the Conduct of Election Rules, 1961 were made, limiting public access to certain documents.
  • The Congress claims the Election Commission cannot amend such crucial laws without public consultation.
  • The amendments are said to reduce transparency and accountability in the electoral process.
  • The changes followed a High Court directive for the Election Commission to provide access to election-related recordings.
“The Election Commission cannot be allowed to unilaterally suggest amendment to such a vital law in such a brazen manner without public consultation.”

This lawsuit underscores the tension between governmental authority and public accountability in the electoral process.
newTitle: Congress Challenges Supreme Court Over Changes to Election Rules

title: Gujarat: Out on bail, accused rapes 70-year-old victim again - Hindustan Times
